title: AFL blocks Cricket Australia holding Sheffield Shield final at Adelaide Oval
description: Football code has rights to premier venue from 15 March each yearSouth Australia to host domestic decider at Karen Rolton OvalCricket Australia has been left ‚Äúdisappointed‚Äù after the AFL‚Äôs access to Adelaide Oval was prioritised over South Australian cricketers‚Äô hopes of hosting the Sheffield Shield final at the state‚Äôs premier venue.The final of the men‚Äôs domestic red-ball competition will instead be held at Karen Rolton Oval, on the city‚Äôs western fringe, starting on 26 March. title: ICC Champions Trophy: What next for England and semi finals preview
description: Nas and Ath are in Dubai and are joined by 'friend of the pod', Dinesh Karthik (DK), to look back on England's exit from the tournament and look ahead to India versus Australia, and South Africa against New Zealand in the semi finals of the Champions Trophy. You can follow both matches across Sky Sports.
author: Sky Sports

title: ICC Champions Trophy: England out after dramatic defeat to Afghanistan!
description: Nas and Ath give their immediately reaction to Ian Ward, after England‚Äôs eight-run defeat to Afghanistan knocks them out of the ICC Champions Trophy. Jos Buttler also joins them to reflect on the loss and his future as Captain. ¬†Nas and Ath will be back with a full podcast very soon, so make sure you give this show a follow, so you don‚Äôt miss an episode. You can watch the remaining games in the ICC Champions Trophy on Sky Sports.
author: Sky Sports

title: Rob Key on England‚Äôs Men‚Äôs Cricket
description: Mark Chapman is joined by Michael Vaughan, Jimmy Anderson and England men‚Äôs managing director Rob Key. They talk about where England‚Äôs men‚Äôs cricket is at the moment ‚Äì what‚Äôs next? How will England look to change the picture across the board? And what will the process be to replace Jos Buttler as white-ball captain?
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: Incredible India win Champions Trophy & Rob Key reacts to England‚Äôs woes
description: Simon Mann presents reaction to India beating New Zealand and winning the 2025 Champions Trophy. He‚Äôs alongside England World Cup winner Alex Hartley, the BBC‚Äôs chief cricket commentator Jonathan Agnew & Indian commentator Prakash Wakankar.Hear from India‚Äôs winning captain Rohit Sharma, as well as Virat Kohli. Plus, player of the tournament New Zealand‚Äôs Rachin Ravindra.Also, the managing director of England Men‚Äôs Cricket Rob Key looks back on England‚Äôs poor Champions Trophy performance and gives an insight into the process for selecting the next white ball captain after Jos Buttler‚Äôs resignation.
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: The Shark Sized Banana
description: A preview of the most pointless thing we‚Äôve ever ignored, Mattchin‚Äôs Greatest Ever Quiz, Jimmy has a special present for Greg and we don our monocles and top hats as we head once again to ‚ÄôThe Tat Modern‚Äô. Plus what next for England‚Äôs ODI side, The Hundred draft and Indie News.
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: England are out. Didn‚Äôt want to win it anyway. Next.
description: The Tailenders are joined by Roushan Alam from ‚ÄòThe Bangla Cricket Podcast' to get all the reaction to England going out of the tournament we‚Äôd all forgotten about. Plus we sent Jimmy out as our roving reporter to find out about ‚Äòlife on tour‚Äô, Dry Cleaning with Mahmudullah and trapping India on a plane.
author: BBC Radio 5 Live

title: Jamie Overton 'Mankad's Kiwi batter but doesn't appeal in 'heated' BBL confrontation

description: Sunil Gavaskar has endorsed Venkatesh Iyer¬†as an all-round option for India‚Äôs upcoming Test tour of England starting June next year.

title: The Incredible Hulk
description: Second part of the interview with the giant former England fast bowler Chris Tremlett on how he got to be this big and yet how, without Shane Warne's considerable influence as his county captain he would never have been part of an Ashes winning team. For more on Test cricket and the Ashes go to The Cricverse blog at https://cricverse.substack.com/p/get-in-the-pink-a1e?r=lo2wd Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
author: Simon Hughes

title: Land of the Giants
description: Chris Tremlett, the tallest fast bowler to play for England in Tests, recounts the tale of England's 2010/11 Ashes success, its meticulous planning and execution despite a very inauspicious start when he inadvertently put England's spearhead, Jimmy Anderson, temporarily out of action. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
author: Simon Hughes

title: Can India's men dominate white ball cricket for a decade?
description: On this week's Stumped, Alison Mitchell, Brett Sprigg and Charu Sharmu discuss India‚Äôs dominance of the men‚Äôs white ball game - will it continue all the way through to next year‚Äôs T20 World Cup and beyond? It‚Äôs after India added the Champions Trophy to the T20 World Cup they won in Barbados last year. Virat Kohli reckons this current squad has enough talent to "take on the world" for the next eight years. We speak to Cricket Australia‚Äôs outgoing Chief Executive Nick Hockley. He‚Äôs standing down at the end of this month after five years in charge. He tells us the controversial resignation of men‚Äôs Test captain Tim Paine was one of the most challenging periods of his tenure, but that he and Paine have since spent a lot of time together and he backs him to have a long and successful coaching career.He also told us he believes support for the Afghanistan women‚Äôs team will continue after his departure and that the controversial decision to mark 150 years of England against Australia with a day/night game can celebrate the history of the game whilst also nodding to the future.Plus, we look at what Harry Brook‚Äôs decision to withdraw from the upcoming Indian Premier League means for him and England.Photo: Virat Kohli of India and teammate Rohit Sharma celebrate following the team's victory in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 Final between India and New Zealand at Dubai International Stadium on March 09, 2025 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. (Credit: ICC via Getty Images)
author: BBC World Service

title: Andy Flower on the key to coaching Kohli
description: Alison Mitchell, Charu Sharma and Brett Sprigg are joined by former Ashes winning head coach Andy Flower, who shares his thoughts on England‚Äôs Champions Trophy exit and who should be the next white ball captain? Flower is the head coach of Royal Challengers Bangalore, who are preparing for their 18th season in the Indian Premier League and hoping for their first ever title. He tells us what it is like coaching Virat Kohli and the influence he is having on new captain Rajat Patidar. Flower spent time as a consultant with the Australia team so gives us his insight into Steve Smith after he announced his international retirement from One Day Internationals.The ICC Champions Trophy final is set with India taking on New Zealand in Dubai. We preview the final and analyse where it went wrong for Australia and South Africa. Photo: Coach Andy Flower speaks to his players during an England Lions training session at Allan Border Field on November 24, 2017 in Brisbane, Australia. (Credit: Getty Images)
author: BBC World Service
